articles.title: On first day on Nasdaq, Trump's Truth Social stock soars in early trading
articles.description: Stocks of former President Donald Trump's media company Truth Social rose by about 50% shortly after the stock premiered on the Nasdaq Tuesday before dropping somewhat by the end of the trading day.

articles.title: Obamacare wars heat up as Biden and Trump clash over subsidies
articles.description: Biden calls for extending funding set to expire after 2025 and bashes Trump, an avowed Obamacare foe, who says he wants to improve the 2010 law without explaining how.
articles.content:
President Joe Biden on Tuesday called for extending a subsidy boost under the Affordable Care Act that is set to expire after 2025, underscoring one of the most immediate health care policy implications of the upcoming election.

articles.author: Snopes.com
articles.title: US Gas Prices Dropped in 2020 Because of COVID-19, Not Trump
articles.description: "The drop in March 2020 had everything to do with a massive drop in demand — nothing else," Patrick De Haan from GasBuddy.com told Snopes.
articles.content: On Feb. 21, 2024, a user on X posted a meme showing a photo of a Casey's General Store sign with the regular-grade gas price at $1.19 per gallon. The meme's caption referenced former U.S. President Donald Trump and the upcoming November 2024 election... [5541 chars]

articles.title: Trump’s new media company catches the ‘everything rally’ wave
articles.description: The former US president’s paper wealth has surged with his social media platform listing at an opportune time, with investor risk appetite rising.
articles.content:
Donald Trump, the former US president and the Republican nominee for the November presidential election, has seen his paper wealth surge by billions as investors rushed to snap up shares of his Trump Media & Technology Group.

articles.content:
